alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Dawson County through 400 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Callaway to 9 miles south of Brady. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Dawson County. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 209 and 212. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
